BD Phoenix™ Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent ceftriaxone (0.0625-4 μg/mL) - Streptococcus ID/AST or AST only Phoenix Panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of most aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Ceftriaxone panels for automated antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Streptococcus isolates using broth microdilution.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by MIC of most Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacterial isolates from pure culture, with this notification adding ceftriaxone (0.0625-4 μg/mL) for use with Streptococcus ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels.
